website_summaries.verdict: An affordable camera with an innovative image stabilization feature and an electronic viewfinder.
pros: Suitable for beginners and experienced photographers
cons: Focusing in low light can be challenging
Battery doesn't last very long on a single charge

website_summaries.verdict: Attractive and compact, with a broad feature set, solid kids-and-vacation performance and nice photos, the Olympus OM-D E-M10 Mark II is a good choice for photographers on a budget who like to fiddle.
pros: The OM-D E-M10 Mark II offers some unique but useful features in a smaller-than-a-dSLR design
cons: The grip could be bigger and its continuous shooting can't keep up with the competition
Plus, you really need to read the manual unless you're running on full auto

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, be sure to buy the book
customer_reviews.text: If you are ready to go beyond cell phone pictures and point-and-shoot cameras,then this is a fantastic camera at a great price. I won't even try to mention all the features because it would take all day to describe them. I highly recommend that you buy Supercharging the Olympus OM-D E-M10 by W.N.Green and spend some quality time with your new camera while reading this book. The owner's manual is decent, but there are so many features on this camera that you need someone to help walk you through them and assist you with the settings. It's only 7.99 on Kindle. This is an amazing deal for what you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Mott

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels on new camera
customer_reviews.text: The reviews said this is a stellar shooter. And it IS, as long as you don't want to shoot video at all. While the still images are pretty darn good, the dead pixels - 2 of them show up plain as day in the video and there is not way to remove them in post. Very disappointed - you would think that Olympus could do a better job by either making good sensors, or at least buying good sensors for their cameras. Not likely I will try Olympus again - I only need one lesson to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Tbommy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this camera. The only negative I have is that the card slot broke after only a few weeks use. The company exchanged the entire camera and all seems well so far. (Note: Keep the box even if you love the camera, if you have to exchange any part of the purchase they will require the original box)
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: This OM-D E-M10 II has a "focus peaking" feature that allows great crisp manual focus control
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on prior ownership of Olympus OM-1 and OM-2 cameras and a wish to get into digital SLR without a big bulky DSLR camera. This camera in manual mode and with an inexpensive OM to 4/3 adapter handles my old OM-1 lenses very well. This OM-D E-M10 II has a "focus peaking" feature that allows great crisp manual focus control. One must find the menu and set the native focal length of the manual focus lens and enter that so the in-camera image stabilization works properly. I have been shooting pictures with the OM-1 lenses mainly in Aperture Priority mode, and the camera's automatic exposure setting have worked well, But, these are controllable too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: A lot of camera in a small package, but ditch the kit lens
customer_reviews.text: A great camera capable of amazing image quality. The kit lens leaves a lot to be desired, but the 40-150mm zoom lens is fantastic and I plan to buy a good wide prime. Ok, so why 4 stars. After watching a YouTube video, I realized that out-of-box settings are not great. White balance is set to be abnormally warm (for some reason), and there's a handful more setting that need to be changed to get the best image quality. But, once the camera is set up, its awesome. The kit lens isn't terrible, but its really nothing great either ( I've seen reviews that the kit lens is great... I was disappointed). All pictures I uploaded were with 40-150mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zilic

customer_reviews.title: Taking pictures is fun again
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought! I've had it for just a few days, but I'm really liking it so far. It just makes you want to go and take pictures. It's fun to use and you quickly get comfortable with the huge number of options available. I got the 25mm f1.8 and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David Y

customer_reviews.title: Compact design for on the go
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded to this camera from my really super Olympus Pen Epl1. That was my first camera I ever had and I still love it but it was hard to use in manual mode and had no viewfinder. I was so excited to get my new camera. Its soooooo much easier to use than my old one. Figuring out the dials and settings wasn't too difficult. I'm posting a few quick shots I took when I got it. Those photos were taken with the m.zuiko 45mm lens. Basically it's my new fave cause it's so small and light and easy to grab on the go compared to my Nikon. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E

customer_reviews.title: I love this Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera so far. It has a lot of cool settings and functions to explore. I would definitely buy it again. In fact, I'm selling all my DSLR gear. I love it because it's compact and the picture quality exceeds my old Canon Rebel XS. The camera build seems pretty solid. I got the IIR lens, its not as compact as the pancake EZ lens but the quality is jard to beat. The only thing I don't like so far is the strap. It's too small for a larger man to wear. Buy it, you won't be sorry. Well done Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great camera in a small package
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera with lots of high end features for an amateur or enthusiast. The ability to program the function buttons is particularly useful. The WiFi (together with the app) makes it relatively easy to tether the camera to an iPad. The menu is clunky but I’ve never seen a good camera menu system. My only complaint is the manual that comes with it is not the full one. Download the real one from the Olympus website
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong. Another fine Olympus camera.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great camera, I love it, the only downside is it sucks battery power fast. But a good photographer is always prepared with spares, so I solved that minor setback. I bought the adapter and use my Canon glass with it, if you get the Olympus get the adapter for Canon or Nikon glass it makes a great combo.
customer_reviews.author: Lastinclass

customer_reviews.title: COMPACT VINTAGE SILVER/BLACK STYLING AND GOOD ALL AROUND PERFORMER
customer_reviews.text: The camera looks and feels great with well thought out control features and excellent 4/3 image quality and 5 point image stabilization. The only weak point I've found is the continuous autofocus setting for fast action that may result in missed shots, so I always use spot focus. I really like the light weight compact size for travel and hiking. Take care, unlike the higher end Olympus cameras, the EM-10 is not weather sealed.
customer_reviews.author: robert s

customer_reviews.title: The more you learn, the more you agree!
customer_reviews.text: I normally don’t give 5 stars, but I have to do it for this. Not only was getting two lens and a camera so low amazing, it was beyond belief just how good this camera is. There are more features on this camera than most FF dslrs. Yes, that does mean more menus. Menus come with features. However, would you rather spend your time learning a less capable camera? With Olympus, you get more for your money,period!
customer_reviews.author: JB Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera -- would give it 5 stars were ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera -- would give it 5 stars were it less complex. I have no doubt that Olympus means well, but there is simply no way to use this camera "intuitively". Pity. They haven't learnt the truth of the "less is more" maxim that turns, say, a Leica into a masterpiece. Other than that, it works flawlessly, has a brilliant EVF, a great range of reasonably priced lenses, and is nicely made and finished for its price. Wi-fi works significantly more reliably than in prior model. Olympus' current price for the 40 -- 150mm, f4.0--f5.6 kit lens -- $100 -- is a roaring bargain. Grab it!
customer_reviews.author: PeterD

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line?  I LOVE this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Olympus cameras and waited a long time to be able to get this one. I chose the M-II instead of the M-III because I'm trying to learn more about the finer points of photography and reviews I had read suggested this might be a better camera for me. I'm sure I would have loved the newer model also, but this is simply a fabulous camera and I've barely scratched the surface as yet. I think it might be smarter than I am!!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn A. Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Best value on the market today.
customer_reviews.text: I own a a6000 a t7i and numerous high end point and shoots. This camera is the best value on the market today. The kit lens is sharp and feather light . The real fun is with a asapter and second hand manual lenses . Im selling my a6000 . I cant go back . In body stabilisation on the omd means i can pick up a 30 dollar prime lens and get amazing shots My biggest gripe is the battery cover . Intuitive feel . Exceelent imaging
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hansen

customer_reviews.title: I love my OM-10 Mark II
customer_reviews.text: I love this 4/3 Mirrorless Camera from Olympus. Feels very good in my hands and has great features as a DSLR but much lighter and more compact. A must camera for travelers!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Vitello

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures, light weight and easy to hold.
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying to figure out all the settings - this isn't a beginner beginner camera at all but it takes beautiful pictures, can't wait to use it more and learn more.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: As I mentioned in another review of the camera bag I really haven't used the camera yet. There is so many new features to learn that I didn't have in my 12 year old Nikon/Minolta camera that it is going to take quite a while to learn them all. I hope I'll have a good bit of the basics under my belt before I take my cruise in January of 2020.
customer_reviews.author: ToniA

customer_reviews.title: One and done! Lasted 2 months!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been in search of a small compact camera to carry around instead of my large bulky DSLR. I thought is was the perfect fit. However, it was delivered May 7th and now has an internal issue where it has to be shipped to Olympus for repair in a little over a month!! The issue deals with the image stabilizer (S-IS1), a code that is not even in the manual, go figure!? That's ridiculous even for a $300 model camera. If I could I would definitely return this item, as I feel dooped by purchasing it!
customer_reviews.author: Andre Rolle

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, I was able to reconnect it but it ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe Olympus was so cheap that they didn't include at least a basic SD card! Also, I agree with another reviewer who commented about the cheap construction of the battery compartment door -- First time I opened it, it came off in my hand. Fortunately, I was able to reconnect it but it is so much flimsier than the battery compartment cover on my Olympus DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: kearneyb

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Super compact and lightweight with tons of features. THere's a bit of a learning curve to get the menu/buttons/etc customized like you like it, but once you're familiar with all the menus and settings, it will do a lot. I can't wait to start buying prime lenses for it.
customer_reviews.author: Paige R.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. Lightweight ! Perfect for shooting in manual mode as it has the speed and aperture dials separate and at the fingertips all the time while looking through the viewfinder. Picture quality? As good as a Nikon D-7000. The only drawback until now is that the auto focus doesn't works well when you have very low light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Abad

customer_reviews.title: If you’ve used high quality cameras you’ll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Good beginner camera, feels very plastic, particularly the lenses. The movement is not smooth on telephoto lens. Touch screen flashes on and off when using it to modify photos. Batter provided with camera doesn’t last on. Electronics are amazing, distant items can be enlarged and stay sharp and clear. It’s light weight and compact. Unfortunately I won’t be back from Europe to return it on time.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Tikotsky

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and portable pro spec camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the enthusiast, lots of options with shutter speed aperture etc. Nice resolution in the files, shoots RAW and JPG. Lightweight and is ideal to carry around your neck for long periods. The included kit lens provides enough reach to be useful in day to day shooting. Great camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: The camera is fantastic I recommend it as a starter/entry camera for beginners ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is fantastic I recommend it as a starter/entry camera for beginners looking into budget mirrorless cameras. I did find the menu system highly confusing but there are youtube videos out there that really help you better understand the OS. I returned it though due to finding a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Oh, how I love thee.... let me count the ways.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional, not even close. But, I love this camera. I love the appearance, the quality photos, the awesome battery life, that it connects to my phone to transfer pics, it’s small and light weight, I could go on forever. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Lots to learn, but the Olympus Mark II is so worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to expand my abilities over my E410, which is 10 years old. I was not disappointed. The color is extremely accurate, focus, easier and automatically available on the LED screen. Lots to learn yet, but loving my experiences in spite of winter weather and frequent storms. As it turns out, each camera has its benefits for artistic endeavors.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Graver

customer_reviews.title: Issue with LCD screen
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera as a christmas present for my girlfriend. After spending the money on an SD card, the camera did not work-appears to be an issue with the LCD screen. Will not even take a picture. Very unfortunate after all the money that was spent.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Jones

customer_reviews.title: It is very fast and has a great shutter speed
customer_reviews.text: It is very fast and has a great shutter speed. It's lightweight, came with two lenses and will be great for concerts.
customer_reviews.author: N. rich

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product and Awesome Customer service
customer_reviews.text: Lots of great information on this product! It's great for Street Photography! Focus Camera is quick to respond to any questions or concerns you may have. I'll look to purchase my accessories from Focus Camera!
customer_reviews.author: Monica S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for inexperienced photographer
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this camera! I'm no professional, so I'm not as bothered about having absolutely all of the bells and whistles of more expensive cameras. I took it with me on a quick trip to Yosemite and had a great time playing around with the settings and got some great shots out of it. I really like the fact that a number of different lenses are compatible with this camera so I'm not necessarily locked in to a specific brand. Super light and aesthetically pleasing - someone even thought it was a film camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably great camera for the price. Don't get the Mark III that just came out. It actually removes some features and isn't a good to use to a serious photographer. Also, don't forget you can natively use Lumix lenses! I got the 25mm f/1.7 prime Lumix lens and it's AMAZING. Love my OM-D.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Layne Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to using my smart phone which has been great, but I needed something better for a big outdoor trip. The quality is noticeably better. Especially at night or in situations with less light. For more professional photos there are a lot of other great lenses to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and Shoot mirrorless camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. It takes really great photos and is easy to use. I normally shoot with a nikon d600 but when i dont want to lug that around I take this and its a great camera. My wife uses this when im using my other camera and she loves it. Takes really great photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought a refurbished version and it came looking like new. The only indicator that it was refurbished ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a refurbished version and it came looking like new. The only indicator that it was refurbished was the box. The picture quality is great, and so is Olympus customer service. I'm definitely a novice, so I can't speak to the specs of the camera, but the ease of use is great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Anne S.

customer_reviews.title: The lens was defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this SLR for travel. it is light weight with all the bells and whistles of my much more expensive DSL. The picture quality is fine. It came with two zoom lenses one of which did not work out of the box. the replacement process was extremely slow and tedious.
customer_reviews.author: TRM3

customer_reviews.title: Good, it you like it
customer_reviews.text: I liked it, but it is too complicated for me, and the Camera Raw produces objects that my version of Photoshop cannot deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Scheinberg

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures, very lightweight, and the lenses are easy to change out. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Morris

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful viewfinder, a great appearance, a decent speed of response.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than expected. Some difficulty in management. Sometimes loss of control, requiring reboot, by pulling out the battery. Sometimes it can not bring to sharpness. The battery lasts about 200 shots.
customer_reviews.author: Yuriy V Sharikov

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is nearly perfect. I was worried about it's ability to take low-light photos since it's not a DSLR, but it's not a concern. The camera is everything you want with the perfect balance of size and weight with full functionality. I'm definitely happy with it. You will love the ability to use your smartphone to control the camera wirelessly if you're mounting on a tripod for remote triggering at night.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Bishop

customer_reviews.title: so glad we bought this camera
customer_reviews.text: so glad we bought this camera. I suggest getting the panasonic 25mm prime lens as well we use it more than the package one but what a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Vermeulen

customer_reviews.title: The 5 level steadying program.
customer_reviews.text: I was and still am pleasantly surprised at the light weight and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with this camera. It’s easy to understand and plenty of tutorials online to help. The manual was very helpful. Has WiFi connection to my phone for quick on the go sharing.
customer_reviews.author: E. Feola

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a professional photographer. I love this camera, the design and the pictures it takes. The image stabilizer is not so great with low light. And I’m sure the quality of the pictures increases with a better lense. There were some photos that looked better with my iPhone X, so I’ll definitely get a better lense
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Small package, tons of features.
customer_reviews.text: A great tool in a small package. I was a little nervous when I opened it up as the camera was a bit smaller than expected. Don't be fooled. This camera is super powerful and packed with great features. This is a great tool for beginner hobbyist and those looking to take professional photos alike.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Worley

customer_reviews.title: This little camera is amazing. I have been shooting DSLR’s for years from ...
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is amazing. I have been shooting DSLR’s for years from the Canon 1d the, my current Nikon D7000 that I was going to replace with another DSLR however I was getting tired of lugging around a large camera. I am glad I chose the OMD. This camera is so advanced with stellar photo quality I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stunning photos
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I took it on vacation and the photos were stunning. It is so compact and light that it was an easy decision to take it on all my hikes. I did a ton of research before purchasing and the mirrorless was the right call.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to be a alternate to my E-M5 Mark II. This item will be used interchangeable with the EM-5 mark II for my picture activities. So far I am pleased with the camera and find the performance to be very good. The on camera flash is a plus for times when I need some fill flash on faces. I usually do not carry the external flash when I have the EM-5 Mark II out.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for the price point. Doesn’t have a mike jack but the built in audio still does a great job. Loving it as both a street shooter and video shooter. Either way you can’t go wrong and it can definitely compete with Panasonic and Canon on consumer level video in the micro 4/3 department.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent overall and very compact.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Camera overall. However the Menu is somewhat daunting at first.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera, Questionable seller?
customer_reviews.text: The package might have been tempered with. According to the Olympus website, it's supposed to have a shoulder strap in the box, but this didn't come with a shoulder strap. The camera itself is great though
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Camera
customer_reviews.text: A truly beautiful camera. I understand basic photography, but this is my first digital camera. So this is a challenge, learning the large number of options I can use to control the camera functions. It is a computer designed to create pictures. But I am enjoying the learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: roscoe mckinney

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrific and very capable camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific and very capable camera. I bought it to use as a backup, but found myself loving it. The image quality, in-body stabilization, fast auto focus and multiple programmable buttons make it a very serious camera choice. MFT cameras are truly a blessing for those of us with back problems who can't handle a heavier DSLR kit. Pair the OM-D E-M10 Mark II with any of Olympus' terrific lenses, and you've got a winning combination. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Karen in AZ

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It is easy to use lightweight and small enough for me to carry around without needing an extra bag. Takes great photos.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and feel
customer_reviews.text: Watch youtube to learn the, many, options. Great picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Link37

customer_reviews.title: gimmy that old type of camera.....
customer_reviews.text: this is a do/everything/ type of camera.i find its always with me to partys, dinners,and in my bag.BUY IT YOU WILL LOVE IT...
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: I am a real estate agent and the pictures look great in my listings. The wi-fi feature works flawlessly to my iPhone. The built-in flash works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Boomer

customer_reviews.title: great compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Small lightweight and quiet. With more features and options than I will ever use. Ended up ordering a memory card, spare battery, and 1A filters for the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: john327

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera.
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome camera. Great pictures and clarity. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky S Mills

customer_reviews.title: shaky images and difficulty in focus during night
customer_reviews.text: most of the moving objects are providing shaky images and finding it to focus during night
customer_reviews.author: Rajeev kumar b

customer_reviews.title: but is light and take great pictures and filming
customer_reviews.text: shuttle is a bit slow, but is light and take great pictures and filming. Only battery that I need to buy an extra one
customer_reviews.author: DDMM

customer_reviews.title: Olympus OM-D E-M10 Mark II
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed so far (2 weeks). Still learning, but photos are sharp and clear and low-light performance is better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McClure

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only learned the basics so far but already I love the image quality.
customer_reviews.author: QueenBea

customer_reviews.title: the camera is fantastic. I have no used it much
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my wife, she loves it, the camera is fantastic. I have no used it much, but found no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pics
customer_reviews.text: Compact camera that produces nice photos. What’s not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Peanut jelly and butter

customer_reviews.title: The more in depth manual comes on a cd/dvd which ...
customer_reviews.text: The more in depth manual comes on a cd/dvd which is a shame because what laptop still has a cd/dvd player anymore?
customer_reviews.author: courtneyleigh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with many many options, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: mjord

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures!
customer_reviews.text: I have just started using this camera and I love it! The picture quality is amazing even for a beginner like me.
customer_reviews.author: MIchelle G

customer_reviews.title: First Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur photographer and this was my first camera. I bought it as it was the best bang for its buck. The camera is amazing and takes great photos. It's also a pretty good camera to learn on as I'm currently doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Montano

customer_reviews.title: Olympus has sold me!
customer_reviews.text: The more I use this camera the more I like using it. Great walk around system. Olympus has really stolen my heart from Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Carlous Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Waterfall in Kona, HI
customer_reviews.text: The ease of use and quality of picture is what I love about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Schlitz

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact interchangeable lens camera
customer_reviews.text: Great value! Nice compact interchangeable lens camera. Surprisingly good images with 45mm and 25mm prime lenses. Great travel camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and compact
customer_reviews.text: Beginner hobbyist photographer and I upgraded from a older Nikon D3100 DSLR. this camera has a lot of modern features along with well built and easy to use camera. Check out [...] to see sample images.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: good news
customer_reviews.text: with 14-42mm ez this combination is carry able and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: raymond biasotti

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Good camera + great service... I'll definitely buy other camera accessories and stuff from this shop in near future for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chinakarn

customer_reviews.title: Better handle this camera with extreme care!
customer_reviews.text: I had to send this camera back for warranty repairs after less than 4 months and maybe 1,000 pictures; very disappointing service thus far. The camera is very compact, particularly versus my Nikon DSLR, and takes very good pix but I'm apprehensive about the quality of this product. Fortunately I have 8 more months of warranty support. It appears that I'll need it.Another repair and I'll degrade my review to minimum and request a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Take very good quality photo. Small size, could put in your pocket with EZ lense. Great for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Sean G

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier. Great camera. Great size. Good tactile feedback. Buy a leather case. Perfect for a novice photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING camera. I did a ton of research on mirrorless cameras before I decided on this one. I have always been a Nikon DSLR person but have always hated lugging the bigger cameras around. Thought I would switch over to mirrorless and am so glad I did! This Olympus takes awesome photos, is super easy to use (I don't know why people have so many issues with the settings...I just played around with them and figured them out pretty quickly!), and the lenses are cheap! I adore it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Everything and more than what I expected. Great colors and shots out of the box. Huge feature set, I'll have to get used to. Excellent for an amateur street photographer like myself. I do recommend using a grip.
customer_reviews.author: Badoui S Minaise

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is light weight and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight camera
customer_reviews.text: After years of Canon SLRs and DSLRs, I decided to go mirrorless to reduce weight. This camera works well for me. It takes great photos, and is easy to use. The viewfinder works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Turner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera! I would recommend this piece to anyone. The video function is outstanding
customer_reviews.author: Gary H. Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best First Camera
customer_reviews.text: Looked at many other cameras for weeks. Saw the quality of the photos and had to get my own
customer_reviews.author: ashleys22180

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light and takes good images
customer_reviews.text: Nice, light and takes good images! Lots of things to try. Love the live touch screen with shutter and other controls. Stop action AF a little short on sports focus following the action?
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Fagley

customer_reviews.title: Potter
customer_reviews.text: Almost as good as it's OM 4 T film camera.
customer_reviews.author: potter

customer_reviews.title: THE mirrorless camera to get right now for price/quality ratio
customer_reviews.text: this is THE mirrorless camera to get right now. amazing price/quality ratio. i have had the panasonic GF1 and GX1 before and have been with m43 since the early days. The EM10 II has reached a great level of maturity. The EVF is fantastic (I never liked earlier EVFs), it is compact yet very well laid out. It is fun to use and give great RAW and jpeg images.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Now that I've had it for a little while and I'm learning the menus its even better than I thought the first few days I used ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is remarkable for the price. Now that I've had it for a little while and I'm learning the menus its even better than I thought the first few days I used it. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to upgrade from point and shoot cameras. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon McCustomer Face

customer_reviews.title: Incredible diversity
customer_reviews.text: this is a great camera if you want to own the most complicated, diverse settings of ANY camera I have ever owned. The options and menu settings verge on the ridiculous....If you have a photographic memory, no pun intended, you will love its diversity. If not put the thing on Auto and shoot away.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!  :)
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this camera!! It's easy to use and it's just the right size for easy handling. The viewfinder and the Wifi are awesome features!!! Once the pictures are sent to my phone, they are easy to share on social media, etc.!! I have several lenses, as I have another Olympus camera, and I'm having fun experimenting with all of them!!
customer_reviews.author: Lesa J.

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things about this camera
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this camera. I am an enthusiast user who has owned a number of digital cameras. The menu may be a little confusing at first , but you just have to get used to it. I would recommend this camera to anyone. Takes awesome pictures.
customer_reviews.author: R S

customer_reviews.title: Just love this camera.  Easy to use and great ptotos.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! If you need a small light system camera that can do it all, this is worth a look. Do buy a pair of spare batteries so you are always ready to shoot, and spend some time getting to know the vast possibilities this camera offers.
customer_reviews.author: ivp0

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery and well packaged, however the camera I received is the silver model not the black which was ordered. Box stick-on label correctly shows 'Black'. Serial number on box and camera do match. I may keep the silver rather than returning it since I like both versions. Found the camera to be a bit larger and heaver than expected, but this is not a problem for me. It does have a lot of options to manage. Overall my impression is very good, although strongly recommend buying the Kindle book - Supercharging the Olympus O-MD-E-M10 from Amazon. Now on for a field trial.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conner

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera, great fit for my needs. Still exploring all of its functions.
customer_reviews.author: William Walker Cree III

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! I wanted something lightweight for my backpacking trip, under a thousand, and took great pictures. This camera has it all, I am new to a high functioning camera so I am still learning how to use all my settings.
customer_reviews.author: kiddomarie

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fine "little" camera, but as with the other Olympus cameras, the menu requires a degree in computer science
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: I love my EM10 II
customer_reviews.text: I love my EM10 II. I had the first generation and I am happy with generation 2. The only thing I am unhappy with is the raw files are not compatible with Adobe CS6. So if you shoot raw you will have to put another step into your workflow or upgrade to Adobe CC.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wortham

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro. My basis for comparison is smartphone camera like the lg v20 . i bought also the bigger lens. The pictures quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: yair tzafri

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera. The zoom lens is very sharp. 8x10's are clear and very sharp. Have owned most other brandside in digital plus Canon, Leica, Nikon, Hasselblad film cameras answer strangely would put this with the best. Great camera at great price.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The E-M10 provided a cheaper alternative for her that still gives excellent photo options
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Olympus OM-D E-M5 Mark II and found my wife never got a chance to use it. The E-M10 provided a cheaper alternative for her that still gives excellent photo options. So far it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: JohnC

product_meta.title: Olympus OM-D E-M10 Mark II Mirrorless Camera with 14-42mm II R Lens (Silver)
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Style:without kits| Configuration:Camera w/ 14-42mm IIR LensThe Olympus OM-D E-M10 Mark II is a surprisingly sophisticated camera that's a joy to use. Whether you're a novice just snapping shots of your everyday life or a photo enthusiast looking to maximize your creativity, the E-M10 Mark II delivers with a compact profile, intuitively placed controls, and an advanced 5-axis image stabilization system that ensures perfection with every shot!
feature_bullets: Built-in 5 axis image stabilization for sharper images
2.3 million dot OLED electronic viewfinder with 0.62X magnification

Focusing points/Focusing points selection mode 81 area multiple AF (Contrast detection AF), 37 area multiple AF (Phase difference detection AF); All target, group target area (3x3 area), single target(Standard target size/small target size)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars360 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
